entry.title: Yerevan‚Äôs calls to Moscow hint at thawing relations

media:group.media:title: Yerevan‚Äôs calls to Moscow hint at thawing relations
media:group.media:description:
üìç Yesterday‚Äôs phone call between Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan and his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov, the second in three days, is seen by observers as the latest move by Yerevan to improve its tattered ties with Moscow. üìç Iran‚Äôs foreign minister visits Yerevan and expresses support for an Armenian-Azerbaijan normalization deal and transport links that respect each country‚Äôs territorial integrity. üìç Childhood obesity is on the rise in Armenia, matching trends around the world. üìç Insights: Endless excuses of the Baku regime- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GKrk_oR7B1Y

media:group.media:title: Mastering journalism at AUA
media:group.media:description:
The American University of Armenia is pioneering a master‚Äôs program in multiplatform journalism this June, meant to equip aspiring journalists in the country with the skills to navigate the fast evolving media landscape ‚Äì tailored to the Armenian context. Dr. Shawn McIntosh, the program‚Äôs inaugural chair, talks to CivilNet about the special opportunities the program offers, and explains how strengthening journalism serves Armenia‚Äôs national interests.
0:00 What is AUA‚Äôs new masters in multiplatform journalism program? 3:04 Describing the program‚Äôs curriculum 6:03 Adapting the program to the new technology and the Armenian context 7:15 The importance of teaching trauma-informed journalism 8:38 What are the program‚Äôs aims in Armenia? 9:58 How fostering good journalism benefits Armenia

entry.title: Armenia says no immediate need to end EU observer mission

media:group.media:title: Armenia says no immediate need to end EU observer mission
media:group.media:description:
üìç Bill launching process for Armenia to join European Union passes the parliamentary committee on European Integration in its second reading, and is ready for consideration by the full body. üìç Armenia is open to discuss a new mandate for the EU observer mission if a normalization agreement with Azerbaijan is signed and lasting stability is achieved, but sees no immediate need for the mission to be removed. üìç After the Armenian national football team loses back-to-back matches to Georgia, pressure mounts on the head of its Football Federation to resign. üìç What Turkey wants in the South Caucasus- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YlxFoUr-ODg

entry.title: A gift of education in Lori #shorts

media:group.media:title: A gift of education in Lori #shorts
media:group.media:description:
The Children of Armenia Fund (COAF) has acquired 16 modern buses to be used daily for transporting children from 30 communities in the Lori region to the organization‚Äôs SMART Center free of charge. The initiative is meant to provide children from rural communities safer transport and access to the foundation‚Äôs one-of-a-kind technology center. The purchase of the buses was made possible through a donation from philanthropist Jack Youredjian, who was present at the inauguration ceremony on Friday.

entry.title: Armenia issues $750M eurobond in bid to manage national debt: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia issues $750M eurobond in bid to manage national debt: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç A free trade deal between the Eurasian Economic Union and Iran will go into effect mid-May, a development observers say could significantly boost Armenia‚Äôs economy. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank left interest rates unchanged at 6.75%, citing increased global uncertainty and risks amid U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs escalating trade war. üìç Armenia issued a $750 million eurobond on the London Stock Exchange as it seeks to manage its growing national debt. The bond matures in 10 years with a 7.1% yield. üìç Officials defended Armenia‚Äôs new cryptocurrency regulations, even as firms decried the rules as too onerous and warned they could lead to the sector‚Äôs virtual elimination. üìç Interview with Central Bank Deputy Chair Armen Nurbekyan (in Armenian): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rK6L_8XlVHI üìç Interview with Bitcoin Armenia‚Äôs Eduard Avetisyan (in Armenian): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jK2UUIe7RMk
